paper_title.en: A Simplified Method for the Determination of Total Oxalate-Soluble Pectin Content in Japanese Pear

publication_name.en: Journal of Food Composition and Analysis

paper_title.en: Relationship between the texture and pectin constituents of Japanese pear

description.en: The relationship between texture and pectin constituents and some related compounds of the Japanese pear (Pyrus serotina Rehder var. culta 'Housui') during fruit enlargement and ripening was studied. The modulus of elasticity, deformation ratio, and relaxation value from the flat plate compression test, and all the properties from the puncture test were affected by the pectin constituents, alcohol insoluble solids, and soluble solids. The hardness and deformation of the fruit obtained from the plate compression test might depend on the combination of the alcohol insoluble solids in fresh weight and weight of the fruit. The oxalate soluble pectin both in alcohol insoluble solids and in fresh weight affected the fruit texture more than the water soluble pectin. The solubilization of nonsoluble pectin to water soluble pectin appeared to influence the textural properties more than that of the nonsoluble pectin to oxalate soluble pectin. The puncture test was superior in analyzing the textural properties of the Japanese pear fruits with regard to changes in the pectin constituents.

paper_title.en: Evaluation of the textural properties of Japanese pear

description.en: The texture of Japanese pear (Pyrus serotina Rehder var. culta 'Housui') during fruit enlargement and ripening was evaluated. From the plate compression test, only the deformation ratio, modulus of elasticity, and relaxation were the interpretable textural indices for the Japanese pear. From the puncture test, interpretable textural indices were the rupture force, deformation at the rupture point, roughness, average firmness, initial firmness, apparent modulus of elasticity, bioyield force, penetrating force and penetrating energy in the flesh. The skin of the Japanese pear contributed 70-80% of the firmness of the fruit. As the fruits enlarged, the strain decreased, the elasticity increased, the fruit skin was more prone to mechanical damage, the fruit flesh became softer, and firmness and rigidity of the whole fruit was reduced.

paper_title.ja: 豚尿処理水を用いた溶液栽培技術の開発-水耕培養液としての利用-

description.ja:
豚尿処理水の養液栽培利用に関する可能性について検討するために, 処理水を用いた葉菜類の養液栽培試験を実施し, 植物体の生育状況と植物体による処理水中の無機成分吸収能についての調査を行った.
供試した処理水は, 当場の豚尿汚水処理施設における最終処理槽から採取したものを用いた.養液栽培装置は, 容量15lの市販プランターへ処理水154を入れ, これに栽培ベットとなる発泡スチロール板を浮かべたものを用いた.
栽培作物はサラダナとし, バーミキュライトを入れたプラグ苗ポットで約2週間の育苗を行った後, 発泡スチロールの栽培ベットへ定植した.栽培期間中は, エアーポンプを用いて処理水への曝気を行った.
試験区分は, 処理水をそのまま使用した区を対照区とし, 試験区として, 市販の水耕培養液を使用した培養液区及び処理水に無機成分を追加した追加区の3区とし, 栽培試験は, 処理水による植物栽培の可能性を確認するための短期間の栽培試験 (試験1) , 及び植物体の生長量及び供試した処理水の成分変動を調査するための長期間の栽培試験 (試験II) を実施した.
その結果, 豚尿処理水による水耕栽培において, サラダナは生理障害等を生ずることなく良好な生育を示すことが確認され, さらに, 処理水に数種類のミネラル成分を補うことにより, 慣行で使用される水耕培養液と同様の収量が得られることが明らかになった.また, サラダナの栽培により処理水中における無機成分濃度の減少も確認され, 水質浄化も可能であることが確認された.

publisher.ja: Warm Regional Society of Animal Science, Japan

paper_title.ja: 野菜栽培における多孔質セラミックパイプの応用(第2報) : セラミックパイプ内養液温の調節による土壌温度制御
paper_title.en: Application of Porous Ceramic Pipes in Vegetable Cultivation (Part 2) -Controlling Soil Temperature by Circulating Warm Water in a Buried Porous Ceramic Pipeline-

description.ja: A new irrigating and soil-warming cultivation system was developed. There was only one porous ceramic pipeline that was used simultaneously as an irrigating pipe and as a warming pipe in this developed system. The cultivation experiment with lettuce verified that this system was practical for irrigating and warming soil simultaneously. Because the irrigating was also from the heating pipe, there was not the problem of the soil drying around the pipe. On the basis of surveying the longitudinal and cross-sectional temperature distributions in the bed soil, the heat sources for heating soil were analyzed under different conditions. The relationship between the soil temperature and the circulating water temperature was also studied in different air temperatures. The required water temperature for warming soil was obeyed to the power function of the air temperature in this ceramic pipe system. When the lowest air temperature at night was not less than 6.6°C, 30.0°Cwater was enough if the soil was warmed only to 15°C. The growth and yields of lettuce in the warming treatment were significantly better than those in the no-warming treatment.
description.en: A new irrigating and soil-warming cultivation system was developed. There was only one porous ceramic pipeline that was used simultaneously as an irrigating pipe and as a warming pipe in this developed system. The cultivation experiment with lettuce verified that this system was practical for irrigating and warming soil simultaneously. Because the irrigating was also from the heating pipe, there was not the problem of the soil drying around the pipe. On the basis of surveying the longitudinal and cross-sectional temperature distributions in the bed soil, the heat sources for heating soil were analyzed under different conditions. The relationship between the soil temperature and the circulating water temperature was also studied in different air temperatures. The required water temperature for warming soil was obeyed to the power function of the air temperature in this ceramic pipe system. When the lowest air temperature at night was not less than 6.6°C, 30.0°Cwater was enough if the soil was warmed only to 15°C. The growth and yields of lettuce in the warming treatment were significantly better than those in the no-warming treatment.
